description: I used the FSJ as an orientation year because I didn't know what I wanted to study after school. During this time, I developed personally and built up responsibility, team work and a sense of duty by working with children.

Tapio is a succesful startup that builds an ecosystem for the wood industry. Here I got the great chance to develop technically with a great start-up team. Through my own project I was trained in all areas of frontend software development. I even worked with the team and learned a lot about working with Scrum.
As an assistant in the IT department, I demonstrated my independent working style. Monitoring a mail quarantine was not that demanding, but it had to be done conscientiously.

Pitch Club provides HR software for developers that connects applicants directly with IT executives. Here I was able to apply my knowledge intensively, as I develop a lot frontend issues of this software.
